page.title: 13Mr Kellaway's Farm
page.content: We asked Mr. Kellaway some questions about Edginswell farm. He answered: "I have cows, calves, sheep, lambs and hens at the moment. I have had lambs and beef bullocks already this year and I will be getting calves and store bullocks. In the fields I have potatoes, barley, wheat, oats, cabbage, cauliflower, spring greens, swedes and flat pole plants for sheep feed. I have already harvested winter corn. My farm covers 200 acres. I have seen foxes, rabbits, hares, pigeons, field mice, owls, kestrels, robins, magpies and crows on my land. I have not dug up any hedges this year. I think in ten years time the farm may not exist because it might be used for building as it is next to the Bovis estate.
